intro: Heliophila seselifolia subsp. seselifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved heliophyte, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in wet meadows and along stream banks. It is a herbaceous perennial that blooms from late spring to early summer. Its delicate appearance and preference for wet habitats make it a valuable component of wetland ecosystems.
